title: Who tf did this to Pyke!
body:
https://imgur.com/mMRWaPH

Words do not sum up my disappointment.

replies.body:
They did the same thing with {{champion:28}}'s rework. The teaser made her look like a wraith/not human and in-game she looks way more human (obviously not completely human, but more human than the teaser).
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/EgRZOc4YKmk/maxresdefault.jpg
Pale skin, glowing white eyes, faded purple hands that blend perfectly into the claws at her fingertips
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/8/8f/Evelynn_Update_Screenshots.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170926194205
Blue skin, has normal eyes w/ pupil, cartoon-y, glowing, pointy hands
Tbf the only thing actually differing is a slight colour tone change and the pupils.
The faces do not add up. Eve's in-game face isn't detailed enough nor pale enough. Her eyes never glow like that either nor shows a grimace that menacing.

I mean the faces match up fine imo? 

Detail comes down to Polycount but even then the in-game mode is just as, if not slightly more detailed then the teaser image.
They match up vaguely. Her face is not actually that plump and dark blue in the trailer. I don't see how can you even imply that the trailer is less detailed than the cartoon-y in-game model.

Probably because her face isn't all that detailed in the teaser image? 

It's the same plain face that we see in-game just different coloured with pupils. 

Sure the hands and hair are more detailed, but as for the rest it's not like she any texturing on her skin that would make it any more detailed in comparison. It's a simple marbled look without any blemishes.
Then you need to put some glasses on as the shapes of the cheekbones for example do not add up and neither do the eyes. She is also not really pale enough to match it.

imo the cheekbones match up fine with the in-game model.

I mean I already mentioned the eyes? And the skin colour? 
It feels rather redundant for you too say any of that when the FIRST comment I made was about that. 
In fact the FIRST comment YOU REPLIED TO was about that. 
Do you just lose an argument and then just start rambling off?

I don't care about your opinion and it's not worth discussing.

Secondly, you didn't mention skin colour at all. The eyes only add to my original argument. Have you never had an argument before or are you trying to feel proud of yourself over nothing?

> Eve's in-game face isn't detailed enough

Yeah champ, you got it. When will people finally understand that you can't put on a tiny model seen from 15 meters up high as many details as in a 1080p, hyper focused close up splash art?

Geez, these threads need to stop...
No they literally do not add up because of how they are shaped. I'm not talking about resolution.

Except that you don't understand the difference between a teaser image and an actual in-game model that's supposed to be readable as a champion you're playing.

If they made her pale with no defining purple glow, you'd gotten a bland, picture-esque Eve. Riot's not trying to Picasso that shit. And what's this about here eyes? You can't even see them in the in-game model anyway unless you're intentionally looking at her 3D model on lolking. Or maybe you meant her actual default splash art?

Glowing irises, vertical slit pupils (cat-like) and darkened sclera instead of pure white give her quite the predatory look and yet, mesmerising and pleasing to the eye if you happen to cross paths. You wouldn't run from her during your first encounter. That's the point. Riot wasn't trying to pass Eve as a boogeyman or a horror-show. She doesn't chase her prey.
Idk man, I'd smash 100%
Sadly, there are sacrifices that must be made to make the character read well at a low poly count :(

This.

In addition, if you _did_ put Pyke's mask as-is in the game, it'd look hideous as fuck. This isn't the first or only time either. Zyra doesn't have pupils but nobody really notices because why are you zooming in on her face when Blitz is speeding at you like a freight train?
I notice. Even. Was asked ingame by vs 2 weeks ago if I have a porn folder for Zyra pics because he could not see another reason why to play only her ^^
This sounds like it came from a personal experience.
I notice.  Hence why I'm perma Bronze.

Low poly count? They can make chromas that literally are paintjobs above the textures. This is nothing more than a different paintjox on a piece of cloth.

I'm not talking about the shoulders or the heads although that could be slightly better, i'm mostly talking about the rag, covering his face.

I don't think you understand what a poly count is. Either way, if they made the in-game model bandana the same as the splash bandana, it would basically just look like a red bandana in game. The model is too small and the camera is too far away to actually see that kind of detail, so why bother wasting resources on it?

What are you talking about? It would be fairly noticeable. You're basically saying "People won't see it anyway." when everyone can see it. Obviously i don't mean some finely-tuned details but the general aesthetics would be clearly noticeable.

That's like saying most skins without particle effects don't matter as nobody can see the details on them anyway.

The mask is, like, half a centimeter on your monitor. Making the "teeth" the same as the splash doesn't even give you a pixel per tooth - and that doesn't even take into account the constant movement as you're playing. You can barely even tell there are teeth on the bandana as it is, now.

Except that many champions have tiny details on them that are characteristic for them while invisible in fast-motion. Take Nidalee's marks on her skin for example or Diana's on her forehead. Look at Jhin's mask, which is highly detailed while not very visible from afar or Kayn's marks in Assassin form.

These things do get noticed and Pyke's tomato-paste mask is pretty damn visible from afar.

And your entire argument pretty much confirms my hyperbole. People do see them from afar and so do i.

Everything you are describing is _one_ marking, or a small design. Pyke's is about 30 straight lines clustered together. It is easy to see the other champions' details and tell what they are because they are alone. Pyke's would just be a weird red blob that gets fuzzy every time he moves.

I actually like it, reminds us of his initial design and it has a comedic effect.
This cartoony big grin is funny.

I don't think anyone here's every actually tried to make a model readable from a distance, which is exactly what this is.

Like every other champion in the game, if they were rendered at the same level if detail in the trailer, you would likely not see a lot of their character details, which is not only a waste of resources, but actually clutters up the model and makes it hard to see what it's doing.

League models are made to be readable from the farthest zoom. Zooming in closer with high expectations is only a one-way trip to disappointment land.

Um...So I've only seen that teaser image so far and I gotta say.

This post made me realize that's a bandana, *not* his real teeth. 

I thought he was some hellish creature. So I'm disappointed on a completely different level.
lol, who made that? They could at least get rid of the mouth line and add at least say... 4 more teeth? not that it really matters tho
Looks like some black guy whose having a bad day

I think its funny that after all this time people still don't understand the difference between splash art and in-game models. In-game models are not going to be as detailed... ever. Certainly not as detailed as the pyke splash. 

If they tried, it would come out as a color blob. It's just too much detail. Riot has actually said they do this for clarity reasons. The style of art in their game is for clarity. They do not overload their models with too much detail to avoid rigged edges and color meshes. They favor crisper, cleaner looks for clarity.
I disagree with this to some regard because I think they could have done more with the mask... Instead, Pyke looks like a bandit.
The assassin support needs cheese

Turned it into a plain cheeseburger from McDonalds

Y'all, have you ever actually looked at the in-game assets, pulled apart? The texture files for champions are like... tiny lmao. I don't understand, when you are in a teamfight or whatever, you cannot tell me you ACTUALLY are looking at the minute detail on Pyke's bandanna.

Like, the texture files are 512 X 512.
The splash arts are AT LEAST 1280 x 1024. So they have AT LEAST twice the resolution, and I would not be surprised if splash arts have more resolution than that.

This game is meant to run on lots of different computers, that means small texture sizes and low-poly models. The boards complain all the time that the character model doesn't look like the teasers and splash arts... they probably won't. You should be glad they don't, because it means your friend's toaster can run this game, too.
I started wheezing when I saw him in game tbh, my sister came up behind me and said "looks like the guy I like compared to the guy who likes me." I couldnt stop crying and laughing?

also you did horrible on the emote. your argument on the rakan fan-skin was, that its too detailed and not read-able when zoomed out. yet you do not add more detail to something big popping off on the screen like an emote

i truly support almost everything you guys put out, but this is just lackluster, looks cheap and is underwhelming.
to me the look of something gives it a unique feeling.
having to look at this makes me feel uniquely bad
